predictions.text: The U.S. Senate will confirm Kevin Warsh to serve as Federal Reserve Chair (Powell’s successor) by 2026-10-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the U.S. Senate votes to confirm Kevin Warsh as Federal Reserve Chair (roll-call or voice vote recorded), and the confirmation is publicly reported by Congress.gov and/or the Senate press office by the deadline.
monitoring_signals: White House transmittal of nomination to the Senate; Senate receipt date
Senate Banking Committee hearing scheduling/held
Senate Banking Committee vote to report nomination
Senate floor scheduling and confirmation vote timing
Public statements by key Senators about support/opposition
predictions.rationale: Nomination is already public; confirmation odds depend mainly on committee throughput and whether the majority chooses to prioritize the Fed chair vote amid fiscal and geopolitical disputes.

predictions.text: BLS will report U.S. PPI Final Demand (seasonally adjusted) month-over-month at +0.6% or higher in at least one release with a reference month between 2026-01 and 2026-03, by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if any BLS PPI news release published by the deadline shows 'Final demand' (seasonally adjusted) 1-month percent change >= +0.6% for a reference month Jan 2026, Feb 2026, or Mar 2026.
monitoring_signals: Monthly PPI releases (Feb, Mar, Apr 2026) and revisions
Energy and services sub-index momentum
ISM prices-paid components
Freight rates and fuel price trends
predictions.rationale: December PPI printed +0.5% with hot services; a single +0.6% print over the next three months is plausible if services momentum persists or energy re-accelerates.

predictions.text: LBMA spot silver (XAG/USD) will have at least one trading day with a close-to-close move of 15.0% or more (absolute value) by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if XAG/USD (LBMA spot or a widely cited spot benchmark) shows an absolute percentage change between two consecutive daily closes of >= 15.0% on any date on or before the deadline, as reported by at least one major market-data provider (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, ICE/LMBA references).
monitoring_signals: Implied volatility and options skew in silver
Margin requirement changes at major exchanges/clearinghouses
CFTC COT positioning extremes
Large moves in real yields and DXY
predictions.rationale: After an extreme one-day collapse, tail risk of further high-volatility sessions remains elevated, but a 15% close-to-close move is still uncommon.

predictions.text: The U.S. Department of Justice will announce criminal charges (complaint, indictment, or information) against operators of a major residential proxy network disrupted by Google, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if DOJ (including any U.S. Attorney’s Office) publicly releases charging documents or a press release naming defendants alleged to have operated a residential proxy network that is explicitly linked (by name, domain, or description) to the network Google reported disrupting, by the deadline.
monitoring_signals: DOJ press releases mentioning residential proxy/botnet monetization
Domain seizures (FBI/DOJ banners) tied to proxy services
Court docket activity in SDNY/CDCA/EDVA and other cyber-heavy districts
Additional technical reports naming operators/beneficiaries
predictions.rationale: Major disruptions sometimes precede law-enforcement actions, but attribution and cross-border issues often slow prosecution timelines.

predictions.text: CISA will publish a public advisory/alert (AA, MAR, or similar) that explicitly references exposed or misconfigured Ollama instances (or 'Ollama') and provides mitigation guidance, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if CISA posts an official webpage (AA/MAR/Alert) on cisa.gov by the deadline that contains the term 'Ollama' and includes mitigation steps for exposed/misconfigured instances or related compromise risk.
monitoring_signals: CISA advisories referencing LLM inference servers, RCEs, or data exposure events
Reporting from major security firms on active exploitation of exposed Ollama endpoints
Inclusion of related CVEs in the KEV catalog
predictions.rationale: Given reported large-scale exposure of instances and rising AI infra incidents, a CISA advisory is a coin-flip within two months.

predictions.text: The United Nations will publicly announce a system-wide hiring freeze and/or a formal cash-conservation measure (e.g., delayed reimbursements to troop-contributing countries or postponed program spending) explicitly attributed to liquidity shortfalls, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the UN Secretariat (e.g., the Secretary-General spokesperson, official UN press release, or publicly posted memo) announces a hiring freeze or other explicit cash-conservation action and cites unpaid dues/liquidity constraints as the reason, by the deadline.
monitoring_signals: UN Controller/Secretariat budget memos leaked or posted
Announcements about delayed peacekeeping reimbursements
UN press briefings referencing 'liquidity crisis' or 'cash shortfall'
Member-state arrears reports and emergency assessments
predictions.rationale: Public warnings of near-collapse typically lead to immediate austerity steps; the main uncertainty is whether measures are announced publicly versus handled internally.

predictions.text: OPEC+ will announce an extension of current production quotas/cuts such that at least 1.0 million barrels/day of cuts (collectively) remain in effect through 2026-12-31, by 2026-07-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if an official OPEC/OPEC+ communique, press release, or ministerial statement by the deadline specifies that aggregate cuts/quotas totaling >=1.0 mb/d remain scheduled/in-force through 2026-12-31 (or later).
monitoring_signals: OPEC+ meeting schedule and communiques
Monthly compliance data and secondary-source estimates
Brent curve structure (backwardation/contango) and inventories
Saudi/Russia public messaging on price stability
predictions.rationale: With oil recently firming and OPEC+ focused on discipline, extending meaningful cuts through year-end is more likely than a rapid unwind.

predictions.text: CMS will publish a proposed National Coverage Determination (NCD) or a proposed rule explicitly enabling broader Medicare coverage for anti-obesity medications (AOMs)/GLP-1s for obesity treatment (not diabetes-only), by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if CMS publishes (Federal Register or CMS.gov) a proposed NCD or proposed rule by the deadline that explicitly addresses Medicare coverage eligibility for obesity-treatment medications (AOMs/GLP-1s) beyond diabetes indications.
monitoring_signals: CMS statements on Part D coverage and obesity drugs
White House/OMB regulatory agenda entries tied to obesity/AOMs
Congressional movement on legislation modifying Medicare’s obesity-drug restriction
MA plan benefit designs and CMS guidance changes
predictions.rationale: Industry pressure and capacity buildouts raise the odds of a formal CMS proposal, but statutory constraints and budget scoring may delay action.

predictions.text: The Government of Panama will publicly announce initiation of legal/administrative steps to terminate, revoke, or renegotiate the CK Hutchison port concession(s) at Balboa and/or Cristóbal (Panama Canal terminals), by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if Panama’s executive branch, relevant regulator, or courts publicly announce a filing, decree, administrative proceeding, or formal negotiation mandate explicitly aimed at terminating/revoking/renegotiating CK Hutchison’s Balboa/Cristóbal port concessions by the deadline.
monitoring_signals: Panama government statements on port concessions and national security
Court rulings or prosecutor actions referencing the concession contracts
U.S. diplomatic statements or sanctions/CFIUS-style pressure signals
Company disclosures by CK Hutchison about Panama legal risk
predictions.rationale: Heightened U.S.-China infrastructure contest increases odds of a Panama move, but legal complexity and economic risk make outright termination less than even.
